main event: Two objects, initially observed as the size of a star, moved slowly in a northerly direction, changing colors from blue-white to red over Richmond, California on August 3, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were seen moving at a low speed for a duration of 22 minutes., The colors of the objects changed from blue-white to red during the sighting., The observer, James R. Henderson, considered the objects might have been a star but noted their unusual motion., There were no photographs associated with this report., The case was part of Project Blue Book, a US Air Force program investigating UFOs.
witness description: James R. Henderson, age 24, male, machinist.
